reviewText: A thoughtful presentation of problems humanity has faced for centuries. Maybe one of these days science will find the gene that causes all the craziness, but until then........
Title: Beyond Our Differences

reviewText: This is an excellent documentary. I will counsel anyone to watch it. You will learn something about yourself and the world.
Title: Beyond Our Differences

reviewText: This is both an interesting and intriguing film on the role of religion in many venues from a global perspective. The problems every society faces are brought together in this extensive production where people from a wide variety of backgrounds explore, debate and attempt to bring together the nature of being human in these difficult times where economic,cultural, political and even religious differences often collide. Kudos, once again to The Bill Moyers Journal series.
Title: Beyond Our Differences

reviewText: This film presents religion and spirituality as a positive embodiment of politics, a way to stop war and promote peace rather than create terrorism and violence.  It sounds so easy to understand, but so many simply don't, or won't, get it.  For them, it's easier to hide behind false beliefs and fight for dominance in a world of sectarian divisions and misunderstandings.One criticism I have is that only one person interviewed even mentioned that we also need to help other species.  Religious endeavors should not just be about helping our fellow humans, because humans are only one of many different species who all need assistance of some kind.
summary: A post-9/11 plea for understanding amidst diversity
Title: Beyond Our Differences

reviewText: This film ran on Bill Moyers Journal on 26 Dec. 2008...a remarkable film that focuses upon the idea that religion(s) and mankind should make an effort to realize that all religions and peoples have much in common, and good reason to explore the positive likes and ignore the negative dislikes that cause wars and so very much suffering.  The world would certainly be a much better, more positive place if this could be put into practice.
summary: An inspiring film....suggesting that ALL religions focus upon their similarities and NOT their differences...
Title: Beyond Our Differences
